author: FOX56 NEWSROOM
title: chevron-right
text: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa. (WOLF) â€” A Williamsport man has been arrested and charged after allegedly raping and assaulting a young girl this Summer. 22-year-old Nicholas Allyn Peterson is being charged withrape, sexual assault, strangulation, aggravated indecent assault, indecent assault, and furnishing alcohol to minors. According to the Williamsport Bureau of Police, a female juvenile victim reported the incident that happened on July 16. 2024. According to the young girl's statement, she reported to investigators she along with 3 of her friends, all juveniles, met up with Peterson in Williamsport. The victim says Peterson purchased several alcoholic beverages and then took the girls home to his residence on Scott Street in Williamsport. The girl said she drank, became intoxicated, and asked if she could leave. The victim reported the next thing she could remember was waking up in bed without any clothes on and being strangled by Peterson. She was able to get Peterson off of her with the attack leaving her bruised with facial injuries. After the assault, the young girl went to the hospital for treatment and examination for sexual assault. On Tuesday, an arrest warrant was issued and Peterson was taken into custody. He was arraigned and remanded to The Lycoming County Prison after being denied bail.
